justification: “Prior to the start of the main task, participants filled out the Vividness of Visual Imagery Questionnaire (VVIQ). The VVIQ measures people's general imagery vividness…”
“After each trial, participants were asked to rate their imagery vividness on a scale from 1 (not vivid at all) to 5 (as vivid as real seeing).”
In the fMRI task, “participants rated the visibility… of their visual experience on a 4-point scale.”
“After the main experiment participants performed a standard forced-choice discrimination task… Detection sensitivity was calculated based on performance in the discrimination task as d′.”
“After this, they were asked to rate their confidence in this decision on a five-point scale.”
“Participants were then asked whether they thought a real stimulus had been presented on the last trial, or whether what they had experienced was only in their imagination.”
